info.name: Arcuate nucleus of medulla
info.description: The arcuate nucleus of the medulla is a small group of neurons located on the anterior surface of the medullary pyramids.  Rostrally, they appear to be continuous with the pontine nuclei in the basilar pons.  These neurons receive corticospinal tract input and send their output through the anterior or ventral external arcuate fibers and the stria medullares in the floor of the fourth ventricle to the cerebellum via the inferior cerebellar peduncle.
